passage.title: The note is still in my pocket
passage.paragraph: After Jack buys a piece of meat, the butcher tells him how to cook it. "But I can't remember your words," Jack says. "Will you write them down for me?" The butcher does so.

With the meat in his hand and the note in his pocket, Jack goes home happily. A dog runs after him on the way. Suddenly it comes at him, takes the meat away from him and runs off. Jack stands there and doesn't know what to do.
Then he laughs and says, "Never mind. You don't know how to eat it. The note is still in my pocket."
